name: All Websites - Remove Social Media Junk
description:
Check out the original style at userstyles.org
The purpose of this style is to remove all the annoying toolbars, dropdowns, and popups that frequently serve to distract me from pages I would otherwise enjoy. My basic standard for considering something "junk" to remove is that it covers up the primary content of the page in some way that annoys me. I cannot wait until the collective web recognizes this junk for the blink_tag_2.0 that it is: Obnoxious and unnecessary.
additional_info:
This style will remove:

Wikia : the floating footer
1UP.com floating header bars
AddThis toolbars, buttons, and their annoying popups.
Afterdawn context-word popup ads
WibYa toolbars
AddToAny toolbars
AddToAny Dropdown
Reuters toolbar
CNET Toolbar
and Wordpress.com snapshot popups
SoundCloud track comment popups.
Mediafire "Pro" ad footer
Cracked.com silver bars
ign toolbar, AssociatedContent.com mini bar
gizmodo's permalink ad video
... and a few more. They're all commented with labels.

All of the elements have been commented, so if you use the style and are suddenly missing something, search the style for the site domain that you're on and you should find it for removal.
